citation.article-title: 16S ribosomal ribonucleic acid sequence analyses of lactococci and related taxa. Description of Vagococcus fluvialis gen. nov., sp. nov.

p.s: Vagococcus (Vago. coccus. L. adj. vagus wandering; Gr. n. coccus a grain, berry: M. L. masc. n. Vagococcus wandering coccus)
Cells are ovoid, occurring singly, in pairs or in chains, and elongated in the direction of the chain.
Grows at 10° and 40°C but not at 45°C.
Grows in 4% NaCl but not 6.5% NaCl.
Does not grow at pH 9.6 or survive heating at 60°C for 30 min.
The predominant end product of glucose fermentation is L-lactic acid.
Reacts with Lancefield group N antiserum.
The cell wall peptidoglycan type is LYS-D-ASP.
The longchain fatty acids are of the straight-chain saturated and monounsaturated types.
Hexadecenoic acid is type Δ7 and octadecenoic acid is type Δ9.
The G plus C content of DNA is 33.6 mol%.
The type species is Vagococcus fluvialis.
